name: Multifocal Fibrosing Pseudotumor of the Liver
chief_complaint: I've had persistent right upper quadrant pain and unexplained weight loss for months
physical_findings: palpable liver edge 3cm below costal margin
prognosis: Variable; depends on extent of involvement and response to therapy. Some cases show spontaneous regression while others progress to liver fibrosis
description: An extremely rare benign condition characterized by multiple fibroinflammatory pseudotumors in the liver parenchyma. The lesions mimic malignancy on imaging but show characteristic histopathological features of dense fibrosis with chronic inflammatory infiltrates. Differential diagnosis includes metastatic disease, primary liver tumors, and hepatic sarcoidosis.
